FRS-V^ R PENSIONS.Mote bv the Secretary,On the 23rd April, 1923, in reply to a Parliamentary question, the Chancellor of the Exchequer stetedxthat, after careful consideration the Government had decided, to introduce legislation with the object of improving the scale of Pension increases granted to pre-war Pensioners under the Pensions(Increase) Act, 1920, that a special Committee of the Cabinet1would at once be set up to Fork out a detailed scheme by theearliest possible dote, and that he hoped that it might bepossible to bring in the Bill at an early date.In accordar.ce with this announcement the following committee has been appointed by Lord Curzon on the recommendatioi.of the Chancellor of the exchequer the President of the Board of Education (Chairman), The Secretary of State for Air. The Financial Secretary to the Treasury. The Parliamentary and. Financial Secretary to the Admiralty,The Financial Secretary to the War Office, With Mr, R.B. Howorth as Secretary, The Committee's Terms of Reference are as follows:-To prepare for the consideration of the Cabinet, with as little delay as possible, a detailed, scheme for improving the scale of pension increases granted to pre-war Pensioners under the Pensions (Increase) Act, 1920.,7[Signed.) K.P.A. HANKEY,Secretary to the Cabinet.,Whitehall Gardens, S.W, 4th May, 1923.
